poem:
"Funding Shadows"

Priests of profit, singing high,
In the temple of denial,
A tangle of power, bound in silk ties.
The shipping magnate, like a specter,
His wealth a cruel shroud,
And £200,000 a hymn to ignorance.
Beware, the shattered earth cries,
Your gold will offer no solace,
When the last bird dies.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Who are the wealthy climate sceptics funding rightwing UK politics? But who are they and how are they linked? The biggest donor to the Reform party this year is the shipping magnate Terence Mordaunt, the head of First Corporate Shipping. His personal company, Corporate Consultants Ltd, has given £200,000". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
